sentence: Energy stocks were mostly higher today with the NYSE Energy Sector Index rising about 0.4% while shares of energy companies in the S&P 500 were were ahead by 0.5% as a group.
Crude oil for June delivery settled up 56 cents at $57.88 per barrel while May natural gas futures were down 10 cents to $2.54 per 1 million BTU.

In company news, Star Gas Partners LP ( SGU ) turned higher again in late Monday trading, recouping earlier gains that followed the home heating oil and propane distributor raising its quarterly distribution by 8.6% over its previous payout to $0.095 per common unit, payable May 8 to unitholders of record on April 30.
SGU units were up again about 0.1% at $7.46 each, reversing course after an earlier run to $7.56 per unit.
The stock has traded within a 52-week range of $5.35 to $7.83 per unit, rising almost 16% over the past 12 months prior to today's trading.

(+) WRES, Reaches deal with Procter & Gamble's ( PG ) paper products unit to continue supplying 40 mln BTU of natural gas daily to its industrial facility in Mehoopany, Pa.

(-) MPO, Hires Evercore Group LLC to assist with potential monetization of its operated assets in the Illinois Basin.
The views and opinions expressed herein are the views and opinions of the author and do not necessarily reflect those of Nasdaq, Inc.
